definition[0]: to spend a lot of money on something, not because you want to but because you have to
example[0]: I had to fork out £600 on my car when I had it serviced.
example[1]: We don’t want to have to fork out for an expensive meal.
example[2]: Even more embarrassingly for the struggling bank, it had to fork out a further $2.4 million to end the agreement.
example[3]: Companies will have to fork out for the extra equipment needed to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
example[4]: The company forks out a small fortune on telephone line rentals.
